content.title: REBOA (Resuscitative Endovascular Balloon Occlusion of the Aorta)
content.definition: A minimally invasive resuscitation technique using a balloon catheter to temporarily occlude the aorta, reducing hemorrhage and redistributing blood flow to the heart and brain in patients with non-compressible torso hemorrhage.

hemodynamic_effects: Immediate increase in proximal blood pressure
Cessation of hemorrhage distal to balloon
Augmentation of coronary and cerebral perfusion
mechanism.physiology: Creates temporary internal aortic control similar to aortic cross-clamp

zone_1.location: Left subclavian artery to celiac trunk
zone_1.indications: Abdominal hemorrhage (solid organ, vascular, pelvic with abdominal extension)

zone_2.location: Celiac trunk to lowest renal artery
zone_2.contraindication: No balloon placement - covers visceral vessels

zone_3.location: Lowest renal artery to aortic bifurcation

trauma: Solid organ injury with hemodynamic instability

absolute: Severe aortoiliac occlusive disease preventing access

access.cutdown: May be necessary if no pulse palpable

positioning.method_1: External landmark measurement (xiphoid/umbilicus to access site)

inflation.confirmation: Increase in proximal BP, loss of distal pulses

partial_reboa.concept: Partial balloon inflation allowing some distal flow
partial_reboa.benefits: Reduced ischemia time, less reperfusion injury
partial_reboa.technique: Titrate balloon volume to maintain target BP

duration.zone_3: Up to 4-6 hours possible due to collateral flow
duration.goal: Minimize occlusion time - bridge to definitive hemorrhage control

outcomes.survival_benefit: Improved survival to OR compared to ED thoracotomy in select patients
outcomes.evidence: Observational studies show benefit as bridge to definitive care

content.statement: REBOA (Resuscitative Endovascular Balloon Occlusion of the Aorta) is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Procedures Reboa that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding REBOA (Resuscitative Endovascular Balloon Occlusion of the Aorta) helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of REBOA (Resuscitative Endovascular Balloon Occlusion of the Aorta) include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of REBOA (Resuscitative Endovascular Balloon Occlusion of the Aorta).

clinical_pearls: REBOA = less invasive alternative to ED thoracotomy for hemorrhage control
Zone 1 = abdominal hemorrhage; Zone 3 = pelvic hemorrhage (never Zone 2)
Maximum Zone 1 occlusion time ~60-90 min due to visceral ischemia
Partial REBOA allows some distal flow while maintaining proximal pressure
Goal is BRIDGE to definitive surgical hemorrhage control, not definitive treatment
learning_objectives: Define the three aortic zones and their indications
Understand physiologic effects of aortic occlusion
Know time limits for safe occlusion by zone
